channel.title: Noobs + Searching = Gravedigging?
channel.description:
I've noticed people will usually say "Try using the search button (or feature)" when people ask for help, as their problem may have been covered. I'm sure many others have noticed this as well.
Example: [quote="GrimReapersScythe, post:2, topic:307310"]There are a lot of posts on how to do this. Please use the search bar, before posting. We are not going to spoonfeed you.[/quote] Don't flame me for quoting an example. XP..
Now, while it is very useful for people to search, other people don't understand the concept of "Gravedigging".
Gravedigging usually occurs from people who search, and post on a very old topic. They post, because they never looked at the date the last posted was made on.
If we tell people to search, when they might Gravedig, and we oppose Gravedigging, what's the problem?
I see it as people not looking at post dates. What're your opinions?

item.title: Noobs + Searching = Gravedigging?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Taharok:

Sometimes bumping is legitimate. It’s discouraged to post in a topic that’s over 120 days old, but not against the rules. That’s what you need to understand.

That’s what the Community needs to understand.*

Read full topic

item.title: Noobs + Searching = Gravedigging?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:22, topic:307318”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=403470.msg2989084#msg2989084 date=1255195954]

i gravedigg coz i = noob

You’re the one who has been doing it lately, you’re lucky you haven’t been muted.

no shit right?

Your signature is not funny. Rich is one of the best moderators here.

ONTOPIC: They can have someone make a mod for the board that locks topics that has the last post on it of like 5 months or so…

People should use the search function, I would rather a topic get bumped every now and then rather then every new member post the exact same thread over and over again.

And don’t worry about them not reading the date, it gives them a big red warning when they try and post in an old topic, what more can we do?

Green
[/quote]

Red ;)[/quote]

Hahaha. Dang it your always there to prove me wrong.

And if they can not read that, then they shouldn’t be here

Read full topic

Make the date text BIG like this for example:

It’s not really needed people just insist on not reading the dates, and complaining when they are warned/muted/moderated, etc.

item.title: Noobs + Searching = Gravedigging?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“Explisionist, post:13, topic:307318”]When searching and they post a retarded question/response on it such as on a topic over fixing a glitch they say “yeah i need help with that also” or “Omg i don’t get it, why won’t someone help me.”

Those are pointless to the fact that they did not look at the other page, or only read the first post which was the question… Either way doing so will result in a warning since their main priority is to read the rules before coming acquainted with these forums.[/quote]

That’s to the point…

[quote=“lesterknome, post:12, topic:307318”][quote author=Epic Ancient link=topic=403470.msg2988086#msg2988086 date=1255136666]

The Search Function sucks, only really obvious things can be found with it.
Furthermore, more to the point, their problem is most likely to already be answered within the topic but the person has not bothered to read it properly and just hit that Post button before getting any knowledge from the thread.

99.9999999% of the results turn up in the help section

This is true.

I found that unless you restrict your searches (which many people DO NOT KNOW HOW TO DO…) you find posts from all over the place from all random dates. Based on relevance (totally dumbass if you ask me, but it seems more appropriate), searches get annoying to work with.

I vote MTIB and some other admins clear out posts from 2008-.
2009+ posts only?
[/quote]

You do not know how often i go to the search bar and look up tutorials from 2007. They help.[/quote]
Maybe so, but new members don’t often have the ability to comprehend that they shouldn’t post on the topic. You would think after awhile, people would learn.

(At least move all the posts into a new board, and/or lock them all so ppl can’t reply…)
Would seem like a lot of work for the admins, but wouldn’t it be more-so worth it? :x

Read full topic

item.title: Noobs + Searching = Gravedigging?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

When searching and they post a retarded question/response on it such as on a topic over fixing a glitch they say “yeah i need help with that also” or “Omg i don’t get it, why won’t someone help me.”

Those are pointless to the fact that they did not look at the other page, or only read the first post which was the question… Either way doing so will result in a warning since their main priority is to read the rules before coming acquainted with these forums.

Read full topic

But it seems that newer members lack the motive to click on the Announcement section and browse through that topic and understand what Moparscape wants to accomplish by having the gravedigging policy.

Read full topic
